item.title: Homelab - Day 1 - Really Ghetto Data Storage
item.description:
Setting Up Storage for the Kubernetes Cluster

The first step in setting up my homelab Kubernetes cluster is ensuring some reliable data storage. Right now, I have two main categories of data in mind:

1. Operationally Critical Data

  • Needs RAID with redundancy
  • Requires both on-site and off-site backups
  • Approximately 1TB ‚Ä¶

item.title: Homelab Setup: The Journey to Kubernetes
item.description:
Why I'm Migrating My Self-Hosted Services

I've decided to migrate all my existing self-hosted services‚Äîand add a few new ones‚Äîto a Kubernetes (K8s) cluster that I'm going to build. There are several motivations behind this decision:

Learning Kubernetes Beyond Ephemeral Clusters

You can find the first month here.

item.title: Streamlining OS Development Pipelines for the Beepberry - A Fun Challenge
item.description:
Introduction

Imagine a cool device that brings together an LCD screen, Raspberry Pi Zero, and a Blackberry keyboard ‚Äì that's the Beepberry! It's designed to work like a WiFi-only keyboard phone, and one of the main goals is to reach a super-fast boot time of under 5 seconds. Sounds challenging, right ‚Ä¶

item.title: Harnessing the Power of NixOS for Platform Engineering
item.description:
Introduction

NixOS is an innovative and powerful Linux distribution built on top of the Nix package manager. Its unique approach to package and configuration management sets it apart from traditional Linux distributions, making it an excellent choice for platform engineering tasks. In this blog post, we‚Äôll explore the benefits ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: De-risk early when engineering platforms
item.description:
Platform engineering encompasses a broad domain with continually evolving frontiers that require overcoming new challenges to level up the solutions offered to engineers. However, this evolution can lead to situations where previously-made assumptions may no longer be applicable to new solutions.

Our team recently encountered this scenario when using AWS ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: Reduce developer cognitive load with nix
item.description: Nixpkg is a package manager that uses a purely functional approach to package management, isolating packages and ensuring that there are no conflicts between them. It provides a powerful language for defining packages, which makes it easy to manage dependencies and ensure that software environments are reproducible and reliable. Additionally ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: Physical vs Logical resources
item.description: Logical ID The logical ID must be alphanumeric (A-Za-z0-9) and unique within the template. Use the logical name to reference the resource in other parts of the template. Physical ID A physical ID, which is the actual assigned name for that resource, such as an EC2 instance ID or an ‚Ä¶

item.description:
Digital Minimalism

I'm trying out a month of Digital Minimalism and I wanted some‚Ä¶ encouragement to ensure I stick to my rules. One of which is to use my laptop only for specific tasks I know ahead of time, for an hour a day only. I currently already use Activitywatch ‚Ä¶

item.title: Nonviolent Communication
item.description:
What is Nonviolent Communication?

Nonviolent Communication(NVC) helps us communicate clearly by breaking down and identifying our needs and communicating them compassionately.

Why?

NVC can help reduce conflict towards others and ourselves. It can also help us to hear others out and recognise each other's needs and support acting more ‚Ä¶

item.description: In AWS Lambda, if you use ENVIRONMENT VARS they are tied to the lambda version, so a new deploy is required to update that config change.

Music

item.title: TIL - AWS Summit - ECR
item.description: ECR supports vulnerability scanning of pushed up repo images.
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: TIL - AWS Summit - Eventbridge
item.description: Eventbridge can translate a lot of useful internal Amazon events into a call to say a Lamdba, so you can drive custom behaviour from those events. For example: high vulnerabilities in your pushed ECR image could trigger lambda to fire off an alert(or delete the image).
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: TIL - AWS Summit - Fargate Autoscaling
item.description: Fargate supports autoscaling options that include `FARGATE` or `FARGATESPOT` for spot pricing.
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: TIL - AWS Summit - Latency
item.description: P99 and P95 latency refer to the percentage of requests should be faster than given latency.
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: TIL - AWS Summit - Spot Instances
item.description: Currently, ~5% of spot instances are getting taken out, but their pricing is 1/3 of an On-Demand instance.
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: TIL - Bash Shift
item.description:
In `bash`, use `shift` to reassign positional arguments.

For example:

```bash $1 $2 $3 ```

Would become

```bash $1 matches old $2 $2 matches old $3 ```
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: TIL - Git Rebase
item.description: In git, during rebase, ours and theirs are reversed. `theirs` is actually the current branch in the case of rebase.
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: TIL - How to match python regex postgis
item.description: Use `(.*)` for matching groups in Python regexes.
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: Populate Ansible from Amazon secrets manager
item.description:
One of the ways to improve your security and avoid passing around env files is to follow the twelve factor app and start populating your secrets from the environment. Another improvement is to pull those secrets from a known secret store, with features like rotation, auditing etc.

Requirements

  • Ansible
  • Have ‚Ä¶

Lambda is a terrific piece of kit for all the benefits listed on the AWS product page and Serverless is a very useful framework for developing Lambda functions. However, developing serverless applications locally is a total pain if what you're solving isn't totally trivial.

When things get complicated and your ‚Ä¶

item.title: Freelancer lessons ‚Äì Part 1
item.description: Looking back on this year, many of the lessons I've learned had less to do with specific technologies and more to do with long term career growth. I've been a developer now for 9 years and as a result, I'm starting to think more about longer term goals and happiness ‚Ä¶

item.title: A Short Review of 'Freedom from the Known'
item.description: Freedom from the Known can be a tough book to crack, the lessons offered within are almost dismissed by the arguments made within the book, on top of that it's likely most won't be in a position to even accept what they read as they are reading it. Despite these ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: Faster SugarCRM Development with PHPStorm
item.description:
Javascript development with SugarCRM can be a bit of a pain, however combining PHPStorm's filewatcher tool with a cut down repair script can speed things up to a more tolerable level.

What this setup does is watch for any javascript changes in our custom/ folder(because you're not making core ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: Pomot ‚Äî command line pomotodo client
item.description:
For anyone interested, I've created a simple pomotodo client for interacting with pomotodo.com easily.

You can find it here, feel free to use github issues for any issues or feature requests you can think of.
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: Command line calendars with Khal and fastmail
item.description:
Recently I've been on a bit of a command line kick and I started using khal to render my calendar agenda locally.

All of the codebases used are python based so before I start I've created a virtualenv so as not to pollute my OS.

mkvirtualenv khal workon khal

Vdirsyncer ‚Ä¶

item.title: SugarCRM 7 ‚Äî Conditional Read Only Fields
item.description: SugarCRM has a few ways to set fields as read-only, but it leaves a lot to be desired. One of the missing features that you might need to implement is having a module flagged as read-only on the record view based on a field on the module or the result ‚Ä¶

item.title: NetworkX ‚Äî Get all Paths from all sources to sinks
